AbstractText.sentence: Apoptosis is implicated in the generation and resolution of inflammation in response to bacterial pathogens.

event.clue: Apoptosis is implicated in the generation and resolution of inflammation in response to bacterial pathogens.

AbstractText.sentence: All bacterial pathogens produce lipoproteins (BLPs), which trigger the innate immune response.

AbstractText.sentence: BLPs were found to induce apoptosis in THP-1 monocytic cells through human Toll-like receptor-2 (hTLR2).

event.clue: BLPs were found to induce apoptosis in THP-1 monocytic cells through human Toll-like receptor-2 (hTLR2).

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, BLPs stimulated nuclear factor-kappaB, a transcriptional activator of multiple host defense genes, and activated the respiratory burst through hTLR2.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, hTLR2 is a molecular link between microbial products, apoptosis, and host defense mechanisms.
